definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: We found a drab little joint shoddily decorated for the holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我們找到了一家死氣沉沉的小餐館。

sentences.english: My toys, the ones in my personal collection, are anything but inanimate!
sentences.chinese: 我所收集的情趣玩具中，沒有一件是死氣沉沉的。

sentences.english: Paper-milling is now a dead industry there.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的造紙業現在是一片死氣沉沉。

sentences.english: To the one side of the mountain is the boundless and melancholy marsh.
sentences.chinese: 山那邊是泥澤，死氣沉沉，一望無垠。

sentences.english: Lethargy, laziness, and inactivity is not okay.
sentences.chinese: 死氣沉沉，慵懶和沉默已經不行了。

sentences.english: It’s neither too sleepy nor too intimidating.
sentences.chinese: 它既不死氣沉沉，也不虛張聲勢。

sentences.english: It has not been staler than the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 與過去十年相比，它並沒有變得更死氣沉沉。

sentences.english: She doesn’t want to poke around in that city any longer.
sentences.chinese: 她不想再呆在這所死氣沉沉的城市裏。

sentences.english: It became largely a static, undynamic market.
sentences.chinese: 整個市場變得停滯不前，死氣沉沉。

sentences.english: The front of the house is still standing but the death and destruction abounds.
sentences.chinese: 房子的前半部分仍然站立在那裏，但周圍死氣沉沉。

sentences.english: It was a sleepy little town, about fifty years behind the times.
sentences.chinese: 那是一個死氣沉沉的小鎮，落後於時代約達五十年。

definition: bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: (Tw) (slang) to pass time idly/to chill/to hang out
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
